isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES65-5 - DISASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT

step1.para: Use a suitable puller to remove the countershaft front and rear bearings ( Figure 38). Be sure to pull on the inner race to avoid damaging the bearings.

figure.caption: Figure 38. Remove Countershaft Front and Rear Bearings

warning.para: Always wear safety glasses when pulling components off a shaft to protect your eyes from any flying metal pieces.

step1.para: Remove the snap ring that retains the countershaft drive gear ( Figure 39).

All of the countershaft gears have a keyway in the gear bore and are a press fit on the countershaft ( Figure 40). The 1st speed gear is machined into the countershaft and is not removable. The spacers are interchangeable.

figure.caption: Figure 40. All Countershaft Gears Have Keyway in Gear Bore

step2.para: To Remove Countershaft Drive Gear:Support countershaft drive gear (as close to hub as possible) and press the countershaft until free of the drive gear. Remove the key and slide off the spacer.
To Remove 3rd and 4th Speed Gears:Support the 3rd speed gear and press the countershaft until free of both the 3rd and 4th speed gears. Remove the two keys and spacer.
To Remove 2nd Speed Gear:Support the 2nd speed gear and press the countershaft until free of the 2nd speed gear. Remove the key.
